title: Collaborative Instructional Design Workshop for Mathematics Microlearning: Problem-Solving and Concept Visualization Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational mathematical knowledge (algebra, geometry, statistics) and experience in corporate training design
context.additional_context: Current professionals develop design strategies to optimize math content (calculation problems, graph interpretation, statistical analysis) for mobile environments while fostering learner engagement.

learning_goals: Learners recognize operational approaches and apply collaborative design principles for mathematical problem-solving (e.g., formal derivation, graph utilization) with ≥80% proficiency.
Learners design ≥3 microlearning contents applying mathematical concepts (e.g., equations, probability) from a learner experience (LX) perspective.
Learners apply a question framework (relevance, meaning, emotional consideration) to mathematical proofs and real-world problem-solving to enhance learner engagement.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
